title: Pep Guardiola's Manchester City are a work in progress, but they have plenty of grit and determination
text:
Sport Pep Guardiola's Manchester City are a work in progress, but they have plenty of grit and determination Even if City don't win the Champions League this year, they have already produced one of the best games you will ever see in the competition Share Manchester City's performance was full of quality, drama, grit and determination (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Pep Guardiola was brought to Manchester City with the specific job of delivering the Champions League trophy to the Etihad. 
Even if they fall short this season, Guardiola’s City have already produced one of the best games you will ever see in the Champions League. 
An incredible eight goal thriller full of quality, drama and, above all, grit and determination. 
Because quite how City hauled themselves back from the brink of defeat to a remarkable victory is anyone’s guess. But they did it with a performance which should galvanise the dressing room and leave the players believing anything is possible. Stones, Sane and Aguero all scored to complete the comeback (Photo: Getty) Read More Manchester City 5-3 Monaco: Sergio Aguero scores twice in Champions League classic - 5 things we learned 
At times they were ruthlessly picked apart by Monaco as the French league leaders threatened to give City a real chasing. It looked as if City will have to wait for another year to realise their European ambitions. 
But somehow, through spirit as much as quality, City hauled themselves back into the contest with a never-say-die attitude on a breathless night of high drama at the Etihad. 
It was an incredible game and if City can produce more high adrenaline performances like this then maybe, just maybe, they can thrill us all the way to European glory. 
Incredibly, Monaco have already scored 111 goals this season. And it’s only February. They were quite simply a joy to watch but it was also open season at the Etihad as City’s defence was embarrassingly bad. The Argentine's double underlined just how important he still is to City (Photo: Getty Images) Plenty of speculation continues to swirl around Sergio Aguero's future (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Manchester City 5-3 Monaco player ratings as late goal flurry spares City blushes 
But, in return, Monaco were equally shambolic at the back with their keeper Daniel Subasic complicit as the French side threw away a lead to allow City back into the contest. 
This was nothing short of a classic. By the end, you were left feeling privileged to even be there to witness one of the most astonishing games. 
City, having been overrun, refused to buckle and eventually smashed five past Monaco in a game which will leave every fan wearing blue in the stadium feeling lucky to have been there. poll loading Will Manchester City win the Champions League? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
